citation.article-title: Thalassomonas viridans gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel marine gamma-proteobacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Thalassomonas viridans sp. nov.
Thalassomonas viridans (vi.ri'dans. L. adj. viridans green)
In addition to the characteristics that define the genus, it has the characteristics described below.
Strains grow on MA as regular, opaque colonies that produce a green/blue-green, unstable, diffusible pigment.
They grow in MB with 2-4% NaCl but not with 6% or more.
No growth is observed in STB 2-4% NaCl, in STB 2-4% NaCl plus MgCl2, in STB 2% NaCl plus CaCl2 or in STB 2% NaCl plus MgCl2 and CaCl2.
Strains hydrolyse Tween 80 only after prolonged incubation (more than 7 d).

Strains are able to grow on basal medium supplemented with 0.1 g yeast extract l-1, using the following compounds as sole carbon and energy sources: cellobiose, amygdalin, propionate, L-tyrosine, L-citrulline, glutamine and histidine.
Growth is weak on D-glucose, D-fructose, maltose, sucrose, fumarate and L-leucine.

Neither of the strains utilizes the following substrates: L-arabinose, D-xylose, D-galactose, D-mannose, L-rhamnose, sucrose, lactose, melibiose, salicin, arbutin, D-gluconate, D-glucuronate, D-galacturonate, N-acetyl D-glucosamine, saccharate, glycerate, glycerol, D-mannitol, D-sorbitol, m-inositol, citrate, aconitate, α-ketoglutarate, DL-malate, acetate, DL-lactate, p-hydroxybenzoate, glycine, L-serine, L-glutamate, L-alanine, caminobutyrate, sarcosine and putrescine.
The major fatty acids are 15:0, 16:0 and 17:1ω8c.
Isolated from oysters harvested on the Mediterranean coast of Vinaroz, Spain.
The type strain, XOM25T (=CECT 5083T=DSM 13754T), was isolated from oyster homogenate.
The species also includes strain XOM5 (=CECT 5082=DSM 13753).

The type strain XOM25T differs from XOM5 by the following traits : it is able to use D-ribose, succinate, DL-β-hydroxybutyrate, L-threonine, L-arginine and L-ornithine as sole carbon and energy sources.
